name: reltrls

stmt.origin: relmptopab(hs2, hs0, hs1, ctrls, c0, universe, wa(wbr(cv(hs0), cfv(cwlks, cv(hs2)), cv(hs1)), wfun(ccnv(cv(hs0)))))
stmt.pretty: relmptopab(hs2, hs0, hs1, ctrls, c0, universe, (hs0[(Walks ` hs2)]hs1 ∧ Fun(`' hs0)))

body.origin:
|- wrel(cfv(ctrls, c0))
-| wceq(ctrls, cmpt(hs2, universe, copab(hs0, hs1, wa(wbr(cv(hs0), cfv(cwlks, cv(hs2)), cv(hs1)), wfun(ccnv(cv(hs0)))))))
-| diffsc(hs2, universe)
body.pretty:
⊢ Rel((Trails ` c0))
⊣ Trails =(hs2 ∈ 𝕌 ↦ { < hs0, hs1 > |(hs0[(Walks ` hs2)]hs1 ∧ Fun(`' hs0))})
⊣ d(hs2, 𝕌)

-| diffsc(hs2, universe)
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ Rel((Trails ` c0))
⊣ Trails =(hs2 ∈ 𝕌 ↦ { < hs0, hs1 > |(hs0[(Walks ` hs2)]hs1 ∧ Fun(`' hs0))})
⊣ d(hs2, 𝕌)

-| diffss(hs2, hs0)
-| diffss(hs0, hs1)
-| diffss(hs2, hs1)
body.pretty:
⊢ Trails =(hs2 ∈ 𝕌 ↦ { < hs0, hs1 > |(hs0[(Walks ` hs2)]hs1 ∧ Fun(`' hs0))})
⊣ d(hs2, hs0)
⊣ d(hs0, hs1)
⊣ d(hs2, hs1)

comment: The set ` ( Trails `` G ) ` of all trails on ` G ` is a set of pairs by our definition of a trail, and so is a relation. (Contributed by AV, 29-Oct-2021.)
